intro: Cymopterus humilis, commonly known as the common evening primrose, is a low-growing perennial plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers that open in the evening. The plant has hairy, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in prairies and open woodlands. Cymopterus humilis is known for its medicinal properties, particularly due to the oil-rich seeds it produces.
